title: Intro to Programming
overview:
Edited from terminal (persistedCourse Title: Web Development with MERN Stack
Course Code: WD-301
Instructor: Dr. Dawood
Credit Hours: 3

Course Overview:
This course introduces students to full-stack web development using the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, and Node.js). Students will learn how to design and build modern, scalable, and secure web applications. Emphasis will be placed on front-end design with React and Tailwind CSS, backend API development with Node.js and Express.js, and data management with MongoDB. By the end of the course, students will be able to develop and deploy a fully functional web application.

Learning Outcomes:
By completing this course, students will be able to:

Understand the architecture of the MERN stack.

Develop responsive UIs using React.js and Tailwind CSS.

Create and consume RESTful APIs with Node.js and Express.js.

Implement authentication and authorization using JWT.

Store and manage data with MongoDB.

Deploy applications on cloud platforms (Vercel, Railway, MongoDB Atlas).
resources:
Course Resources:

Books & References:

Learning React by Alex Banks & Eve Porcello

MongoDB: The Definitive Guide by Kristina Chodorow

Node.js Design Patterns by Mario Casciaro & Luciano Mammino

Online Resources:

React Documentation: https://react.dev

Node.js Documentation: https://nodejs.org/en/docs

Express.js Guide: https://expressjs.com

MongoDB Docs: https://www.mongodb.com/docs

Tailwind CSS: https://tailwindcss.com/docs

Video Tutorials (Free):

Traversy Media: MERN Stack Crash Course (YouTube)

Net Ninja: React + Node Tutorials (YouTube)

Tools Needed:

Code Editor: VS Code

Postman for API Testing

Git & GitHub for version control

MongoDB Compass for database visualization

Evaluation Criteria:

Assignments & Quizzes – 30%

Midterm Exam – 20%

Final Project (MERN Web App) – 50%

title: Machine Learning & Neural Networks
overview:
Course Title: Machine Learning

Course Code: ML-401
Instructor: Dr. Ayesha Malik
Credit Hours: 3

Course Overview:
This course provides an introduction to the fundamental concepts and techniques of Machine Learning. Students will explore supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning methods, with hands-on practice using real-world datasets. Practical implementation will be done using Python libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, and Matplotlib. By the end of this course, students will be able to build and evaluate predictive models.

Learning Outcomes:

Understand the key concepts of supervised and unsupervised learning.

Apply algorithms like regression, classification, clustering, and decision trees.

Preprocess and analyze datasets for ML tasks.

Evaluate models using metrics like accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score.

Implement ML workflows using Python and Scikit-learn
resources:
Course Resources:

Books & References:

Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow by Aurélien Géron

Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning by Christopher M. Bishop

Online Resources:

Scikit-learn Docs: https://scikit-learn.org

Kaggle (datasets + tutorials): https://www.kaggle.com

Coursera: Andrew Ng’s ML Course

Tools Needed: Python, Jupyter Notebook, Google Colab, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib

Evaluation Criteria:

Assignments & Quizzes – 25%

Midterm Exam – 25%

Final Project (ML model) – 50%
